summary: The Click to Cancel Act of 2025 aims to codify the Federal Trade Commission's (FTC) click-to-cancel rule into law. This rule, issued on November 15, 2024, relates to the Negative Option Rule. The bill stipulates that violations of this section are treated as violations of the FTC Act, allowing the FTC to enforce the rule with the same powers and penalties. The Act essentially gives legal force to the FTC's regulation regarding how consumers can easily cancel subscriptions or recurring charges.
